html: Man’s abasement and Jehovah’s exaltation characterize this and the following verses (vv 12-22). What is high and mighty, Jehovah lays low, and by so doing gains glory (Isaiah 5:16; 13:11, 19; 26:4-6; 47:1-5). What is of him—including his people who keep the terms of his covenant—is exalted together with him (Isaiah 46:13; 52:1-3; 60:1-2; 62:1-3). The words “in that day” denote Jehovah’s Day of Judgment, also called the “Day of Jehovah” and “day of vengeance” (Isaiah 13:6, 9; 30:25; 34:8; 61:2). Then takes place a reversal of circumstances between the righteous and the wicked.
